channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What U.S.-Korea Ties Mean on the 75th Anniversary of the Incheon Landing
item.description: Incheon, the site of a crucial battle of the Korean War, has a singular place in South Korea’s modern history and in its ties with the United States.

item.title: What to Know About Covid Vaccines This Fall
item.description: The F.D.A. and the C.D.C. have both weighed in, but confusion remains. Here’s what to know.

item.title: Trump Says U.S. Will Institute $100,000 Fee for H-1B Visas
item.description: Administration officials said the charge would help American workers. President Trump also announced the terms of a new “gold card” program.

item.title: U.S. Attorney Investigating Letitia James Resigns After Trump Seeks to Oust Him
item.description: Erik S. Siebert had hit roadblocks investigating New York’s attorney general, Letitia James, and the former F.B.I. director James B. Comey.

item.title: Trump’s Threats to Media in Jimmy Kimmel Fallout Resemble World Autocrat
item.description: The tactics President Trump has embraced place the United States in awkward company as freedom of expression is declining in dozens of countries.

item.title: Brett James, writer of ‘Jesus, Take The Wheel,’ dies in plane crash at 57
item.description: The small plane with three people aboard crashed “under unknown circumstances," the FAA said in a preliminary report.

item.title: It’s time for Intel to go private, former board members say
item.description: After taking rival Nvidia into its major shareholders, it's time for the government to arrange for Intel to go completely private.
